item.title: Canada Says Network Devices Compromised in China-Linked Hack
item.description: Canada’s cybersecurity agency said Chinese-backed hackers were likely behind recent malicious activity targeting domestic telecommunications infrastructure, warning that three network devices registered to a Canadian company were compromised in the attacks.
item.dc:creator: Layan Odeh

item.title: How Robotic Hives and AI Are Lowering the Risk of Bee Colony Collapse
item.description: After 150 years without minimal innovation, the beehive is getting an upgrade that is making it easier to protect colonies and the crops that rely on them.
item.dc:creator: Brian Kahn

media:content.media:description: Eliyah Radzyner, beekeeper and co-founder at Beewise Technologies, opens the solar-paneled lid of the company's robotic beekeeping system, the BeeHome.

item.title: Giuseppe Paleologo on Quant Investing at Multi-Strat Hedge Funds
item.description: How do you actually make money?
item.dc:creator: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal

media:content.media:description: Stock market information at the Nasdaq MarketSite in New York, US, on Wednesday, April 9, 2025. Five days after President Donald Trump’s America-versus-the-world trade war threw stock and bond markets around the world into disarray, he backpedaled and, in the process, pulled the financial system back from the brink.

item.title: Odd Lots: Quant Investing at Multi-Strat Hedge Funds (Podcast)
item.description: Quantitative investing is one of those terms that you hear all the time, but there’s various explanations of what it actually means, or how quants actually make money. And of course, the term means different things in different contexts. In this live episode, recorded at the Bloomberg Equity Intelligence Summit on June 12, we speak again with Giuseppe Paleologo, the head of quantitative research at Balyasny Asset Management. We talk about his role, what quant investing actually is, and what the
item.dc:creator: Tracy Alloway, Joe Weisenthal

item.title: Andreessen Horowitz Backs AI Startup With Slogan ‘Cheat at Everything’
item.description: Andreessen Horowitz led a $15 million funding round for an artificial intelligence startup called Cluely Inc., famous on social platforms like X for controversial viral marketing stunts and the slogan “cheat on everything.”
item.dc:creator: Brunella Tipismana Urbano

media:content.media:description: Cluely Co-founders Neel Shanmugam, left, Roy Lee, center, and Alex Chen.

item.title: Apple Executives Have Held Internal Talks About Buying AI Startup Perplexity
item.description: Apple Inc. executives have held internal discussions about potentially bidding for artificial intelligence startup Perplexity AI, seeking to address the need for more AI talent and technology.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: The Perplexity app Photographer: Stefani Reynolds/Bloomberg

item.title: Circle Gets Buy Rating After Senate Passes Stablecoin Bill
item.description: Circle Internet Group Inc.’s shares jumped 20% on Friday after Seaport Global gave the stablecoin issuer its first buy rating in the wake of the US Senate’s move this week to pass legislation setting up regulatory rules for cryptocurrencies pegged to the dollar.
item.dc:creator: Monique Mulima

media:content.media:description: Circle signage during the company's IPO on the floor of the New York Stock Exchange in New York on June 5.

item.title: SoftBank’s Son Pitches $1 Trillion US AI Hub | Bloomberg Tech 6/20/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde discusses SoftBank founder Masayoshi Son’s pitch to build a trillion-dollar AI industrial complex with TSMC in Arizona. Plus, the global robotaxi market heats up as Baidu looks to expand internationally and Tesla prepares to launch its service in Austin. And Meta rolls out new smart-glasses in a partnership with Oakley. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: NYC Sets Smaller Driver Pay Bump After Uber, Lyft Pushback
item.description: New York City on Friday announced new minimum-pay rules for rideshare drivers, settling on a smaller-than-proposed 5% increase following pushback from Uber Technologies Inc. and Lyft Inc.
item.dc:creator: Natalie Lung

media:content.media:description: Lyft Inc. and Uber Technologies Inc. logos a vehicle in New York.

item.title: LinkedIn’s CEO Has Advice to Help AI-Proof Your Career
item.description: LinkedIn’s CEO offers his thoughts on how AI is changing the way people work, himself included. But first…
item.dc:creator: Shirin Ghaffary

media:content.media:description: Ryan Roslansky, chief executive officer of LinkedIn Corp., in Singapore, on Thursday, Oct. 17, 2024. Acquired by Microsoft in 2016 for $26 billion, LinkedIn has pushed for more engaging content for years, luring influencer-types while encouraging people to post more often.

item.title: Meta Discussed Buying Perplexity Before Investing in Scale
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. held discussions with artificial intelligence search startup Perplexity AI Inc. about a possible takeover before moving ahead with a multibillion-dollar investment in Scale AI, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman, Katie Roof, Riley Griffin

media:content.media:description: The Perplexity AI logo during a news conference at the SK Telecom Co. headquarters in Seoul, South Korea, on Wednesday, Sept.4, 2024. Photographer: SeongJoon Cho/Bloomberg

item.title: Meta Launches $399 Oakley AI Glasses With 3K Video Recording
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc. is going up-market with its surprise hit smart glasses, rolling out new models with Oakley that are aimed at athletes and include improved video recording.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: Oakley Meta HSTN

item.title: Aflac Reports Potential Leak of Personal Data in Breach
item.description: Aflac Inc. said a recent cybersecurity breach could have given intruders unauthorized access to customers’ personal information, including Social Security numbers, as well as health and claims data.
item.dc:creator: Cameron Fozi, Jake Bleiberg

item.title: Israel Says Iran Is Hacking Private Security Cameras
item.description: Iran is tapping into private security cameras in Israel to gather real-time intelligence about its adversary, exposing a recurrent problem with the devices that has emerged in other global conflicts. Bloomberg's Michael Shepard reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Dark Web Forum Tried to Hide by Shifting to Privacy-Focused Crypto
item.dc:creator: Cameron Fozi

item.title: Startup Too Good To Go Weighs €300 Million Funding Round
item.description: Too Good To Go, which operates an app that allows users to buy near-expired food at a discount, is considering raising €200 million ($231 million) to €300 million in a new funding round to support its business expansion, people familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Vinicy Chan, Sara Sjolin

media:content.media:description: Too Good To Go app

item.title: Amazon Ends Speedy Delivery by Kia Soul in Favor of Gig Workers
item.description: Amazon.com Inc. is ending an experiment that saw drivers in Kia Souls make same-day deliveries and will rely on its network of gig-economy workers instead.
item.dc:creator: Matt Day

media:content.media:description: An Amazon contract worker stacks packages onto a luggage cart outside an apartment building in New York, US, on Tuesday, April 16, 2024. Amazon.com Inc. is scheduled to release earnings figures on April 30.

item.title: How Telegram Became a Magnet for Extremists, Crime
item.description: Messaging service Telegram is one of the most downloaded apps worldwide. Its private chat setting has made it a free space for open discussion in countries with authoritarian regimes. But a relatively light-touch approach to content moderation on Telegram is frustrating governments trying to stop criminal activities and the spread of misinformation that can destabilize societies.
item.dc:creator: Eleanor Thornber, Jeff Stone

media:content.media:description: Pavel Durov Photographer: Chris Ratcliffe/Bloomberg

item.title: Chip Stocks Slide on Report of New Possible Limits on China
item.description: Shares of Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. and other chipmakers slid on Friday after the Wall Street Journal reported that the Trump administration is considering further restrictions on China.
item.dc:creator: Dana Wollman, Catherine Lucey

media:content.media:description: A robotic arm moves 300 mm silicon semiconductor wafers inside a sorting machine in a cleanroom at the Globalfoundries Inc. semiconductor fabrication plant in Dresden, Germany, on Wednesday, Nov. 30, 2022. As the US has implemented unexpectedly strict rules on the transfer of semiconductor technology to China, the EU has paved the way for chipmakers to receive unprecedented state funds to build production sites as part of its EU Chips Act. Photographer: Liesa Johannssen/Bloomberg

item.title: Trump Pledge of Quick China Magnet Flows Has Yet to Materialize
item.description: Almost 10 days since President Donald Trump declared a “done” trade deal with Beijing, US companies remain largely in the dark on when they’ll receive crucial magnets from China — and whether Washington, in turn, will allow a host of other exports to resume.
item.dc:creator: Jenny Leonard, Mackenzie Hawkins, Joe Deaux, Gabrielle Coppola

media:content.media:description: NdFeB alloy strip at the Australia Strategic Materials Ltd.'s Korean Metals Plant, in the Ochang Foreign Investment Zone, in Cheongju, South Korea, on Tuesday, June 10, 2025. Australian Strategic Materials Ltd. produces alloys for magnets at a plant in South Korea. Photographer: SeongJoon Cho/Bloomberg

item.title: German Startup Neura Robotics Eyes Up to €1 Billion Round
item.description: German startup Neura Robotics is targeting to raise as much as €1 billion ($1.2 billion) in new funding as the company prepares to debut a humanoid robot, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Aaron Kirchfeld, Eyk Henning, Mark Bergen

media:content.media:description: A Neura Robotics robot demonstrates ironing.

item.title: Trust in AI Strongest in China, Low-Income Nations, Study Shows
item.description: A United Nations study found a sharp global divide on attitudes toward artificial intelligence, with trust strongest in low-income countries and skepticism high in wealthier ones.
item.dc:creator: Magdalena Del Valle

media:content.media:description: Attendees at a conference in Shenzhen, China.

item.title: Tencent Music Shares Double on Break From China Price Cut Script
item.description: China tech investors weary of the nation’s relentless price competition can look to one pocket that’s thriving by moving in the opposite direction: online music.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang

item.title: One in Four Indians Uses Only a Mobile for Content, Ditching TV
item.description: Nearly one in four Indians said in a survey they use only mobile phones to consume media content, as TVs stay unaffordable for many, prompting companies from Meta Platforms Inc. to Netflix Inc. to boost digital strategies in the world’s largest consumer market.
item.dc:creator: Satviki Sanjay

media:content.media:description: A billboard advertising Netflix shows in Mumbai, India.

item.title: Nidec CEO Stresses Compliance in Shift From Fixation on Growth
item.description: Nidec Corp. founder Shigenobu Nagamori said the Japanese maker of precision motors is prioritizing compliance, stepping away from a half-century-long focus on profit and growth.
item.dc:creator: Yuki Furukawa

media:content.media:description: Shigenobu Nagamori

item.title: ICG Targets €10 Billion for Flagship Flexible Capital Fund
item.description: Intermediate Capital Group Plc. is looking to raise €10 billion ($11.5 billion) for its flagship flexible capital strategy, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Silas Brown

media:content.media:description: The City of London. Photographer: Jason Alden/Bloomberg

item.title: HBO’s ‘Mountainhead’ Depicts Hollywood’s Sinister View of Tech Titans
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ellen Huet looks at how HBO’s movie Mountainhead shows the changing cultural view of tech’s rich and powerful.
item.dc:creator: Ellen Huet

media:content.media:description: Cory Michael Smith, Steve Carell, Ramy Youssef and Jason Schwartzman star in Mountainhead.

item.title: Masa Son Pitches $1 Trillion US AI Hub to TSMC, Trump Team
item.description: SoftBank Group Corp. founder Masayoshi Son is seeking to team up with Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co. to realize what could be his biggest bet yet — a trillion-dollar industrial complex in Arizona to build robots and artificial intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Min Jeong Lee, Mackenzie Hawkins, Anto Antony

media:content.media:description: Masayoshi Son

item.title: Pignataro’s ION Plans to Invest in Azimut-Backed Fintech
item.description: Andrea Pignataro’s ION Group plans to buy a minority stake in a new Italian digital bank backed by private equity firm FSI SGR SpA and asset manager Azimut Holding SpA, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Daniele Lepido, Sonia Sirletti

media:content.media:description: Andrea Pignataro, chief executive officer of ION Trading UK Ltd., in London, UK, on Thursday, Feb. 9, 2023. The hackers behind the recent ransomware attack on ION Trading UK, which upended derivatives trading around the world, claim the extortion payment was paid.

item.title: California Utilities Expand Power Shutdowns as Winds Rise
item.description: California utilities cut power to more than 62,000 customers across the state in an attempt to stop wildfires from starting as dry winds sweep the region.
item.dc:creator: Brian K Sullivan

media:content.media:description: Transmission towers alongside a Pacific Gas & Electric Co. substation in Crockett, California. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg
